page.title: 11BUS STATION
page.content: GALASHIELS BUS STATION IN STIRLING STREET IS MAINTAINED BY LOWLAND SCOTTISH,NEWLY FORMED FROM A SPLIT UP OF SCOTTISH OMNIBUSES.GOVERNMENT POLICY FAVOURS OPENING UP MONOPOLIZED ROUTES TO PRIVATE GROUPS,AND THE NATIONALLY OWNED BUS COMPANY RESPONDED TO THIS BY FORMING SUBGROUPS. BUS SERVICES TO MOST PARTS OF THE COUNTRY STOP AT THE BUS STATION,AND FROM THERE IT IS POSSIBLE TO GET THROUGH COACHES TO CITIES SUCH AS ABERDEEN,GLASGOW,NEWCASTLE,BIRMINGHAM, CARDIFF AND LONDON.LOCAL SERVICES RUN TO ALL PARTS OF THE REGION INCLUDING ONE TO PEEL HOSPITAL. THE DEPOT FOR LOWLAND SCOTTISH IS IN DUKE STREET AND IT IS HERE THAT THE BUSES ARE CLEANED,SERVICED,MAINTAINED AND MANAGED.
